comments.raw_text: This makes things like getting the Debug constructor function, for use in the rest of initialization, much nicer.
comments.text:
Created attachment 559576
Patch

This makes things like getting the Debug constructor function, for use in the rest of initialization, much nicer.

comments.raw_text:
Review of attachment 559576:
-----------------------------------------------------------------

I'm not a fan of this change. I don't really understand the ins and outs of why js_InitClass isn't appropriate here, but it doesn't seem to me that Debugger.cpp has unusual needs. Since what's happening here is a common pattern, we should have functions that are well-designed enough that we can use them, without confusion, in all/most of the other instances of this pattern.
